page.description: SQL::Argument Class properties and an example.

property.name: Name
property.description:
Type: C
Mode: R
The unique name of the argument. Note. An argument name cannot be changed while it is part of a collection.

property.name: Data
property.description:
Type: A
Mode: R
One of the Alpha Anywhere primitive types listed below:

property.name: Usage
property.description:
Type: [SQL::ArgumentUsage]
Mode: R
Defines when to set the value of an argument.

page.description: The SQL::Argument object defines a single argument to be passed to a SQL method in a SQL::Arguments collection.
page.example: dim args as SQL::Arguments dim arg as SQL::Argument arg.data = "VT" arg.Name = "State" ? args.add(arg) = .T. ? args.find(arg.name) = Data = "VT" Name = "State" Usage = 0
